perturbation.original_text: Member covenants and agrees that during the Post-Term Period (defined below), except as otherwise approved in writing by Franchisor, Member shall not, either directly or indirectly, own, manage, engage in, be employed by, advise, make loans to, consult for, or have any other interest in any Competitive Business that is, or intends to operate, within a three (3) mile radius of the premises of your Franchised Business or within a three (3) mile radius of any Franchised Business then-operating or under construction to operate under the System.
perturbation.changed_text: Member covenants and agrees that during the Post-Term Period (defined below), except as otherwise approved in writing by Franchisor, Member shall not, either directly or indirectly, own, manage, engage in, be employed by, advise, make loans to, consult for, or have any other interest in any Competitive Business that is, or intends to operate, within a one (1) mile radius of the premises of your Franchised Business.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by reducing the non-compete radius from three (3) miles to one (1) mile during the Post-Term Period. This conflicts with the original intent of protecting Franchisor's market and creates uncertainty regarding the enforceable scope of the non-compete agreement.

perturbation.original_text: As used in this Agreement, the term “Post-Term Period” shall mean a continuous uninterrupted period of two (2) years from the date of: (a) a transfer permitted under Section 14 of the Franchise Agreement; (b) expiration or termination of the Franchise Agreement (regardless of the cause for termination); (c) termination of Member’s employment with Franchisee; and/or (d) a final order of a duly authorized arbitrator, panel of arbitrators, or a court of competent jurisdiction (after all appeals have been taken) with respect to any of the foregoing or with respect to the enforcement of this Agreement; either directly or indirectly (through, on behalf of, or in conjunction with any persons, partnership, corporation or entity).
perturbation.changed_text: As used in this Agreement, the term “Post-Term Period” shall mean a continuous uninterrupted period of five (5) years from the date of: (a) a transfer permitted under Section 14 of the Franchise Agreement; (b) expiration or termination of the Franchise Agreement (regardless of the cause for termination); (c) termination of Member’s employment with Franchisee; and/or (d) a final order of a duly authorized arbitrator, panel of arbitrators, or a court of competent jurisdiction (after all appeals have been taken) with respect to any of the foregoing or with respect to the enforcement of this Agreement; either directly or indirectly (through, on behalf of, or in conjunction with any persons, partnership, corporation or entity). However, for employees terminated without cause, the Post-Term Period shall be one (1) year.
perturbation.explanation: This changes the definition of the 'Post-Term Period' from two (2) years to five (5) years, creating a direct contradiction with the previous definition and increasing the scope of non-compete obligations. Additionally, the introduction of a one-year Post-Term Period for employees terminated without cause introduces another layer of ambiguity and inconsistency, potentially leading to disputes over which period applies in specific situations.

perturbation.original_text: 3. Injunctive Relief. Member acknowledges that any failure to comply with the requirements of this Agreement will cause Franchisor irreparable injury, and Member agrees to pay all court costs and reasonable attorney’s fees incurred by Franchisor in obtaining specific performance of, or an injunction against violation of, the requirements of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 3. Injunctive Relief. Member acknowledges that any failure to comply with the requirements of this Agreement may cause Franchisor irreparable injury, and Member may be required to pay court costs and attorney's fees incurred by Franchisor in obtaining specific performance of, or an injunction against violation of, the requirements of this Agreement. However, injunctive relief shall not be available if the Member is no longer employed by the Franchisee.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces uncertainty regarding the availability of injunctive relief by changing 'will cause' to 'may cause' and 'agrees to pay' to 'may be required to pay'. It also adds a condition where injunctive relief is unavailable if the member is no longer employed. This creates a contradiction, as it's unclear when and under what circumstances injunctive relief can be sought, especially when conflicting with other sections where non-compete obligations exist regardless of employment status.
